posts.html:
@ToidiDiPuts

They're not $125 a pop. They're ~$125 for FOUR. That's 31.25 a pop. They seem to be averaging around $30 right now. Be sure to check quantities on eBay. If anyone is selling a single one for $125, stay away from that auction. Better than Jace? I don't think so. Still, I think it's a great card with a lot of potential, especially given how popular Knight of the Reliquary is.

Interesting note. At the pre-release yesterday, I cracked a Sun Titan in my sealed deck and went 4-2, top 8. My brother cracked Grave Titan and Inferno Titan and used them both to go undefeated. Top 8 decided not to play so we split the packs evenly. Everyone got 10. I cracked an Inferno Titan and Frost Titan. He got another Grave Titan. Neither of us got a Primeval Titan and I didn't hear about anyone else getting one. Super Ultra rar... (see all)

posts.post_content:
@ PhyrexianLobbiest  
  
A better plan  
  
Turn one: Forest, Elves.  
  
Turn Two: Land, Tap both and the elves for Growth spasm  
  
Turn Three: Land, Tap 4 land, the elves, sac the spawn, Titan, search for two [Eldrazi Temple](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eldrazi Temple)  
  
Turn Four: Land, Swing with Titan, get 2 Temples/[Eye of Ugin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eye of Ugin). Play something.  
  
And in case you haven't won by this point.   
  
Turn 5: Land, swing, 2 more temples/[Eye of Ugin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eye of Ugin), [Emrakul, the Aeons Torn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Emrakul, the Aeons Torn)

Posted By: f_fivefiftyseven (7/10/2010 1:49:57 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The fact that it searches up any land makes this thing quite dangerous when combined with RoE. Eldrazi Temple? Eye of Ugin? Yes please. For 6 mana you get 2 nonbasic lands hitting the field and a target that pretty much \*has\* to be removed. If you're to get it out on T5, on T6 with just two Eldrazi lands and the other mana you used you can hard cast Kozilek - not bad at all.  
  
After further gaming, it looks like he makes GW Emeria somewhat feasible (though almost certainly not T1). Emeria has suffered to land destruction (Ruinblasters) and Spreading Seas in the past, so has really needed Trace of Abundance making the green splash desirable but difficult. But with Primeval Titan not only being able to dig up the necessary plains but also the Emerias themselves, things get easier.  
  
T1: Emeria  
T2: Forest + Trace of Abundance  
T3: Plains + Cultivate into 2xPlains  
T4: Plains + Primeval Titan into 2xPlains  
  
If they don't have an answer to Primeval Titan before he can swing, you'll all but acti... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content: Got one in a booster pack at the prerelease. This thing is absolutely insane, and only its mana cost keeps it from being absolutely broken (but its Mythic rarity will keep it at a comfortably insane price only manchildren or people with lots of spare cash will pay. Thanks, Wizards. ¬\_¬). Unanswered, this thing can pull out all the lands in your deck in only a few turns. Hell, just plopping this down and then two [Terramorphic Expanse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terramorphic Expanse)s equals to your deck being thinned by four cards. Easily the best Titan.
